Detailed Description

Class to handle output of intermediate grids to MDV. Deals with two and three dimensional data, float and ui08.

Author:
Niles Oien

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

outputMdv::outputMdv ( string  url,
string  name,
string  forecastFilename,
string  truthFilename,
Mdvx::master_header_t  mhdr,
Mdvx::field_header_t  fhdr,
Mdvx::vlevel_header_t  vhdr 
)

The constructor. Makes copies of the three dimensional master, field and vlevel header and sets up a two dimensional surface vlevel header for local internal use.

Parameters:
url The MDV URL to write to.
name The name for this particular threshold. Appended to the URL.
forecastFilename The forecast file name.
truthFilename The truth file name.
mhdr The MDV master header
fhdr The MDV field header, three dimensional.
vhdr The MDV three dimensional vlevel header.
Returns:
No return value.
Author:
Niles Oien oien@ucar.edu

outputMdv::~outputMdv (  ) 

Destructor. Does the MDV write, if fields were added.

Returns:
None.
Author:
Niles Oien oien@ucar.edu

Member Function Documentation

void outputMdv::addField ( ui08 *  data,
fl32  bad_data_value,
fl32  missing_data_value,
string  name,
string  longName,
string  units,
bool  is3D 
)

Add a data field of type ui08. Overloaded with adding a type of fl32.

Parameters:
data Pointer to the ui08 data. If NULL no field is added.
bad_data_value fl32 value to use for bad data.
missing_data_value fl32 value to use for missing data.
name Name of the output field
longName Long name for output field
units Units of output field.
is3D Boolean indicating if data dimensions are nx by ny or nx by ny by nz
Returns:
None
Author:
Niles Oien oien@ucar.edu

void outputMdv::setForecastMode ( bool  forecastMode  ) 

Set the MDV write mode to be forecast - or not.

Parameters:
forecastMode Boolean indicating if we are in forecast mode. Or not.
